Load edgelists

Edgelists.Rd

Get the edgelist(s) from a PNAAssay, PNAAssay5 or a Seurat object. The edgelist(s) are stored on disk in the PXL files, so the method only works if the paths are set correctly (see ?FSMap).

Usage

Edgelists(object, ...)

# S3 method for class 'PNAAssay'
Edgelists(object, lazy = TRUE, ...)

# S3 method for class 'PNAAssay5'
Edgelists(object, lazy = TRUE, ...)

# S3 method for class 'Seurat'
Edgelists(object, assay = NULL, meta_data_columns = NULL, lazy = TRUE, ...)

Arguments

object

An object with polarization scores

...

Not implemented

lazy

A logical indicating whether to lazy load the edgelist(s) from the PXL files

assay

Name of a CellGraphAssay

meta_data_columns

A character vector with meta.data column names. This option can be useful to join meta.data columns with the proximity score table.

Value

Edgelists: Edgelist(s)

See also

Other spatial metrics: ColocalizationScores(), PolarizationScores(), ProximityScores()

Examples

library(pixelatorR)

pxl_file <- minimal_pna_pxl_file()
seur_obj <- ReadPNA_Seurat(pxl_file)
#> ✔ Created a <Seurat> object with 5 cells and 158 targeted surface proteins
el <- Edgelists(seur_obj[["PNA"]], lazy = FALSE)
el
#> # A tibble: 528,594 × 7
#>    marker_1 marker_2    umi1    umi2 read_count uei_count component
